title: Prince William & Kate Middleton To Skip 2025 BAFTA Awards
description: Prince William and Kate Middleton are not expected to attend the 2025 British Academy Film Awards (BAFTA). Kensington Palace confirmed on February 10 that the Prince and Princess of Wales would not attend the BAFTAs ceremony on Sunday, February 16. Although the royal couple will not be in person, Prince William is expected to pre-record […]
author: Armando Tinoco
excerpt: Prince William and Kate Middleton are not expected to attend the 2025 British Academy Film Awards (BAFTA).
text: Prince William and Kate Middleton are not expected to attend the 2025 British Academy Film Awards (BAFTA). Kensington Palace confirmed on February 10 that the Prince and Princess of Wales would not attend the BAFTAs ceremony on Sunday, February 16. Although the royal couple will not be in person, Prince William is expected to pre-record an appearance, which will be showcased at the star-studded event on Sunday night. The future king of England has been the president of the British Academy of Film and Television Arts since 2010 and is set to visit the London Screen Academy on Wednesday. Prince William made an in-person appearance at the 2024 gala by himself shortly after it was announced Middleton had undergone surgery before revealing she was undergoing cancer treatment the next month. Watch on Deadline It was in 2023 when Prince William and Middleton last attended the BAFTAs together, but it was not the first time they skipped the gala. In 2021, Prince William skipped the ceremony following the death of his grandfather, Prince Philip, and in 2022, the couple also missed it due to diary constraints. Doctor Who alum David Tennant is set to host the BAFTAs, marking the second consecutive year he has taken on the task. Conclave, the film starring Ralph Fiennes, leads the pack of nominated films with 12, while Emilia Pérez scored 11 nods. Anora, The Brutalist, A Complete Unknown, Conclave, and Emilia Pérez compete in the Best Film category. In the Best Director category, the following filmmakers are nominated: Jacques Audiard (Emilia Pérez), Sean Baker (Anora), Edward Berger (Conclave), Brady Corbet (The Brutalist), Coralie Fargeat (The Substance), and Denis Villeneuve (Dune: Part Two).
html:
Prince William and Kate Middleton are not expected to attend the 2025 British Academy Film Awards (BAFTA).

Kensington Palace confirmed on February 10 that the Prince and Princess of Wales would not attend the BAFTAs ceremony on Sunday, February 16.

Although the royal couple will not be in person, Prince William is expected to pre-record an appearance, which will be showcased at the star-studded event on Sunday night. The future king of England has been the president of the British Academy of Film and Television Arts since 2010 and is set to visit the London Screen Academy on Wednesday.

Prince William made an in-person appearance at the 2024 gala by himself shortly after it was announced Middleton had undergone surgery before revealing she was undergoing cancer treatment the next month.

Watch on Deadline

It was in 2023 when Prince William and Middleton last attended the BAFTAs together, but it was not the first time they skipped the gala. In 2021, Prince William skipped the ceremony following the death of his grandfather, Prince Philip, and in 2022, the couple also missed it due to diary constraints.

Doctor Who alum David Tennant is set to host the BAFTAs, marking the second consecutive year he has taken on the task.

Conclave, the film starring Ralph Fiennes, leads the pack of nominated films with 12, while Emilia Pérez scored 11 nods.

Anora, The Brutalist, A Complete Unknown, Conclave, and Emilia Pérez compete in the Best Film category. In the Best Director category, the following filmmakers are nominated: Jacques Audiard (Emilia Pérez), Sean Baker (Anora), Edward Berger (Conclave), Brady Corbet (The Brutalist), Coralie Fargeat (The Substance), and Denis Villeneuve (Dune: Part Two).
